title: Virgin Galactic aircraft returns to flight
summary: The carrier aircraft for Virgin Galactic’s suborbital spaceplane made its first flight in more than a year Feb. 15 as the company moves one step closer to beginning commercial service.

title: Boeing opens SLS EUS production facility
summary: Boeing has opened the production facility where it will build a new upper stage for an upgraded version of the Space Launch System.

title: Europe approves multi-orbit connectivity constellation plan
summary: Europe’s ambitions for a sovereign connectivity constellation are now in the hands of industry, the European Parliament said Feb. 14 after voting to approve the 6 billion euro ($6.4 billion) plan.

title: Pentagon working with Congress on unclassified space strategy
summary: The Defense Department’s space policy office is drafting a congressionally mandated report explaining how the U.S. will defend satellites in orbit.

title: On National Security | A coming of age for commercial satellite imagery
summary: “Someone’s on the move,” Jeffrey Lewis tweeted on Feb. 23, 2022, the day before Russian forces invaded Ukraine. Known on social media as @ArmsControlWonk, Lewis had been tracking Russian movements in the days preceding the invasion, using synthetic aperture radar (SAR) satellite data from a commercial company, Capella Space. In a recent interview with SpaceNews, […]
